instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight for one second then nothing/ screen goes off once at login screen
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight for one second then nothing/ screen goes off once at login screen[/PLAIN]

This board was definitely liquid damaged at some point and then run through an ultrasonic cleaner. No green light no matter what DC in board or I/O cable I use BUT fans spin and board boots. The backlight on a known good screen stays on for 1 second then shuts off but shows image. The board boots to the login screen then after about a second or two it shuts off but the fans still spin. I ran flux under the SMC after removing the edge bonding to see if maybe there was crap under it giving me no green light or the shutdown but no dice. The only other thing on the board that looks burned are pins 19,21,23,25,27, and 29 on J9500. How do I approach this repair do I remove J9500 and clean the pads/run jumpers or is there a different way to fix this? Is this even fixable at all?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight for one second then nothing/ screen goes off once at login screen
threads.message: Replace connector and repair traces, pin 27 is <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>, this is why backlight shut off and pin 19 is <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, this is the reason of no green light...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight for one second then nothing/ screen goes off once at login screen
threads.message: Ok will do and yeah I kinda figured on both of those. Will do then gonna be a fun one lol

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight for one second then nothing/ screen goes off once at login screen
threads.message: Replaced J9500 and ONLY had to jump <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> got green light and the backlight issue fixed! Now gonna run ASD to finish this sucker off! (fingers crossed)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight for one second then nothing/ screen goes off once at login screen
threads.message: Passed ASD good to go! Mark as solved and thanks for the help!
